data:
Sure, I can help you organize the stakeholders involved in the product development of PREVENT-IA based on their level of involvement and importance. Here are the four stakeholder groups and a table explaining their involvement:

1. Core Team
* Product Manager: Responsible for defining the product vision, strategy, and roadmap. They will work closely with the development team, designers, and other stakeholders to ensure the product meets the needs of its users.
* Development Team: Responsible for building and maintaining the product. They will work closely with the product manager, designers, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is delivered on time and to the required quality.
* Designers: Responsible for creating the user interface and user experience of the product. They will work closely with the product manager, development team, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is intuitive and easy to use.
* Data Scientist: Responsible for developing and implementing the AI models used in the product. They will work closely with the development team, product manager, and other stakeholders to ensure the AI models are accurate and effective.
1. Frequent Involvement Stakeholders
* Subject Matter Experts: Responsible for providing expertise in Occupational Risk Prevention (ORP) and ensuring the product is accurate and informative. They will work closely with the development team, product manager, and designers to ensure the product meets the needs of its users.
* Compliance Officer: Responsible for ensuring the product meets all relevant regulations and compliance requirements. They will work closely with the product manager, development team, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is compliant.
* Sales and Marketing Team: Responsible for promoting the product and generating leads. They will work closely with the product manager and other stakeholders to ensure the product is positioned correctly in the market.
* Legal Team: Responsible for providing legal advice and ensuring the product is compliant with all relevant laws and regulations. They will work closely with the product manager, development team, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is legally sound.
1. Occasional Involvement Stakeholders
* HR Team: Responsible for managing the employee training process and ensuring all employees are up-to-date with their ORP training. They will work closely with the product manager and other stakeholders to ensure the product is integrated into the employee training process.
* IT Team: Responsible for managing the infrastructure and security of the product. They will work closely with the development team, product manager, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is secure and scalable.
* Customer Support Team: Responsible for providing support to users of the product. They will work closely with the development team, product manager, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is easy to use and any issues are resolved quickly.
1. Seldom Involvement Stakeholders
* Executive Team: Responsible for providing strategic direction and oversight to the product development process. They will work closely with the product manager and other stakeholders to ensure the product aligns with the company's overall strategy.
* Investors: Responsible for providing funding for the product development process. They will work closely with the executive team and other stakeholders to ensure the product is delivering value to its users and investors.
* Regulators: Responsible for regulating the use of AI and ensuring the product is compliant with all relevant regulations. They will work closely with the product manager, development team, and other stakeholders to ensure the product is compliant.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
